notes: The LLM incorrectly classified the contract as safe. The contract contains a clear DoS vulnerability in the emptyCreditors() function. The function checks if creditorAddresses.length > 1500, but an attacker can repeatedly call addCreditors() to grow the array beyond 1500, then cause emptyCreditors() to revert due to the 2300 gas stipend limitation when transferring to msg.sender (though no transfer occurs here, the array deletion of 1500+ elements would exceed gas limits in a transaction). More critically, the function has no access control and the loop-based deletion is gas-intensive. The ground truth identifies this as a DoS vulnerability in emptyCreditors(), but the model missed it entirely.
